newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open flat to $5 lower.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open flat to $5 lower.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open unchanged to $5 a tonne lower on Friday, as strength in the U.S. dollar against the British pound is expected to weigh on New York cocoa, traders said.
Sterling opened more than a cent weaker against the U.S. dollar Friday, despite the hike in UK interest rates.
London cocoa futures were tightly mixed early Friday, with LIFFE July cocoa unchanged at the midday break, at 995 stg. September was off one stg, at 1,015 stg.

Thursday, New York cocoa futures ended mixed, with much of the day's activity centered on the switches. July eased $1 a tonne on the day, to $1,419, after ranging from $1,408 to $1,427. September softened $2, at $1,459, trading from $1,448 to $1,465, while the remaining months rose between $3 and $9.
Traders said today's July options expiry could push the market toward $1,400, a widely-held strike price, but most expected the expiry to be uneventful.
